Posted By: Wyldblayde (4/17/2010 9:35:16 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
used this as my main win condition at prerelease. by the time that you reach eight mana, most opponents will have used most burn and removal and usually are topdecking for it. if you pop this in on a 1/1 flier in your first main phase, it is a complete finisher. just to be safe i usually set up protection the turn before with a cheap umbra on the creature thats about to go eldrazi.
  
   
@clockwork it has the extra advantages because enchanting creatures risks losing card advantage. if i throw this down and an opponent responds with terminate i just lost two cards for one. by giving it the versatility as well as the extra power over the eldrazi creatures it balances the risks with added power, therefore increacing its playability to around the same level as the eldrazi creatures.
posts.html:
used this as my main win condition at prerelease. by the time that you reach eight mana, most opponents will have used most burn and removal and usually are topdecking for it. if you pop this in on a 1/1 flier in your first main phase, it is a complete finisher. just to be safe i usually set up protection the turn before with a cheap umbra on the creature thats about to go eldrazi.

@clockwork it has the extra advantages because enchanting creatures risks losing card advantage. if i throw this down and an opponent responds with terminate i just lost two cards for one. by giving it the versatility as well as the extra power over the eldrazi creatures it balances the risks with added power, therefore increacing its playability to around the same level as the eldrazi creatures.
